page.title: 10Landscape south: FINTRY
page.content:
This area is dominated by steep slopes and high land reaching well over 400m. This high land is made of lava which was probably extruded from the vents at{Dunmore and Dungoil,}two prominent hills.
The valley of the{River Endrick}has been given the characteristic wide{ {U shape}by the ice flowing from Loch Lomond during the ice age.{Striations} (glacial scratches) can be clearly seen on{Dunmore.}A{glacial lake delta is located at 635.858 along with { {fluvio-glacial deposits. { River features are very varied ranging from the steep and dangerous{Gonachan {Glen}to the wide flood plain of the {Endrick.
